body:
## Expected Behavior

`temporal_` metrics emitted properly.

## Actual Behavior

Metrics get emitted to a no-op scope, and not to the underlying Micrometer MeterRegistry.

This occurs because metrics scope bean fails to configure properly before being supplied to other temporal configuration. It waits to run after `CompositeMeterRegistryAutoConfiguration` (https://github.com/temporalio/sdk-java/blob/2322bd0da735fe310b7291f3b7fbeda10bdf5e40/temporal-spring-boot-autoconfigure/src/main/java/io/temporal/spring/boot/autoconfigure/MetricsScopeAutoConfiguration.java#L18), however the package for this class changed to `org.springframework.boot.micrometer.metrics.autoconfigure.CompositeMeterRegistryAutoConfiguration` in Spring Boot 4.

## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

  1. Update application to Spring Boot 4
  2. Check if metrics are emitted to Micrometer properly

## Specifications

  - Version: 1.32.1
  - Platform: Mac/Linux
title: Spring Metrics Configuration fails with Spring Boot 4
